column4: ubuntu upgraded itself and now when I try to install skype it says wrong architecture!!! it was working fine before the upgrade... whats wrong?
have you changed your medibuntu source to be jaunty, not intrepid?
I did not change anything manually... there was a message taht do u want to upgrade to 9.04? and I said yes..It did everything automatically and when I restarted skype was gone...
It's because it's not in the standard ubuntu repositories, you have to add the medibuntu ones that correspond to jaunty
how do I do that?
follow the link ubotto gave you, and go to 'Adding the Repositories'
and then?
follow the instructions on screen (use the ones for jaunty...)
I followed the instructions..but I still get the error "wrong architecture" from skype.deb
did you download the .deb from skype's site?
yes
I have a 64bit kernel
ok, I think you downloaded the 64bit one rather than the 32bit one (or vice versa)
but you can now just install it through synaptic/apt-get/aptitude
the problem is that there is only one version
and have it autoupdate (which is nice)
let me try that
good point, I think they fail....
it actually worked... thanks for the help
good, no
...problem
